summary: More than 1,000 homeless people were referred to a charity in Wales last year.
A man has been charged after firearms and money were seized by police in Edinburgh.
Four black people accused of torturing a mentally disabled man in a video broadcast live on Facebook have been denied bail.
West Bromwich Albion have appointed Reading director of football Nick Hammond as their new head coach.
The "fasting-mimicking" diet can regenerate the pancreas, say US researchers.
There is not a lot of buzz about the planned merger of two of the world's biggest eyewear firms, Essilor and Luxottica.
naghel Houvenaghel has become the latest high-profile cyclist to criticise British Cycling.
If you go to a comedy club in Texas, you're likely to be laughed at.
The news that Ofcom, the competition watchdog, has ruled that BT will not have to spin off part of its Openreach business sent BT's shareholders into a tizzy.
Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers is relishing the prospect of taking his side to Hampden for Sunday's Scottish Cup semi-final against Rangers.
Queen's University in Belfast is to cut more than 1,000 student places over the next three years.
An NHS trust has apologised after 850 appointment letters were sent out containing the wrong leaflet for a patient.
Labour is "trying to get a compromise that will work" on the Brexit bill, the shadow foreign secretary has said.
Torquay United manager Kevin Nicholson says he will not receive any money from Eunan O'Kane's move to Bournemouth.
A man who was found dead in the Menai Strait had been visited by a police officer while in hospital, an inquest has heard.

A former chief scientist at Nasa has urged US scientists not to give up data on climate change.
The Specials have paid tribute to their former drummer Brad Bradbury who has died at the age of 60.
Tiger Woods missed the cut at the Farmers Insurance Open as England's Justin Rose leads by one shot.
Former England striker Andy Cole says he is still not able to walk without the aid of a cane as he continues his recovery from a kidney transplant.
Pakistan has lifted its ban on YouTube, three years after the video-sharing site was blocked over content deemed insulting to Islam.
Leicester Tigers wing Tom Benjamin is likely to miss the rest of the season with a knee injury.
Welsh cyclist Owain Doull has become the first Welshman to win two Olympic gold medals.
Floods in the western Indian state of Gujarat have killed more than 300 people this year.

Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) has been fined a record HK$110m ($13m; £8m) by Hong Kong regulators for failing to prevent fraud.
The stars of this year's Baftas have been talking about everything from Meryl Streep's speech to Spider-Man: Homecoming.
It has been a remarkable start to the year for Andy Murray.

A shot has been fired at a car near a primary school in Liverpool, police have said.
Great Britain's Jessica Ennis-Hill remains on course for Olympic qualification after the second day of the Hypo-Meeting in Gotzis, Austria.

Broadcaster Stephen Robinson has described Highways England's plans for a Stonehenge tunnel as "old-fashioned". "Both of Highways England's options involve huge and damaging new roadworks gouged into our most important ancient landscape." A spokesman for Highways England said: "We fully understand the cultural heritage of the site

Prostate cancer is one of the most deadly forms of cancer in men.

exploratory drilling for oil and gas has been given the go-ahead by Natural Resources Wales.

A moratorium on fracking in Wales remains in place, the Welsh Government has said.
